Class ContractTestUtils

    Utilities used across test cases

      • assertPropertyEquals

        public static void assertPropertyEquals(Properties props,
                        String key,

        Assert that a property in the property set matches the expected value
        Parameters:
        props - property set
        key - property name
        expected - expected value. If null, the property must not be in the set

      • writeAndRead

        public static void writeAndRead(FileSystem fs,
                Path path,
                byte[] src,
                int len,
                int blocksize,
                boolean overwrite,
                boolean delete)
                         throws IOException
        Write a file and read it in, validating the result. Optional flags control whether file overwrite operations should be enabled, and whether the file should be deleted afterwards. If there is a mismatch between what was written and what was expected, a small range of bytes either side of the first error are logged to aid diagnosing what problem occurred -whether it was a previous file or a corrupting of the current file. This assumes that two sequential runs to the same path use datasets with different character moduli.
        Parameters:
        fs - filesystem
        path - path to write to
        len - length of data
        overwrite - should the create option allow overwrites?
        delete - should the file be deleted afterwards? -with a verification that it worked. Deletion is not attempted if an assertion has failed earlier -it is not in a finally{} block.
        Throws:
        IOException - IO problems

      • writeDataset

        public static void writeDataset(FileSystem fs,
                Path path,
                byte[] src,
                int len,
                int buffersize,
                boolean overwrite)
                         throws IOException
        Write a file. Optional flags control whether file overwrite operations should be enabled
        Parameters:
        fs - filesystem
        path - path to write to
        len - length of data
        overwrite - should the create option allow overwrites?
        Throws:
        IOException - IO problems

                 Path path,
                 int len)
                          throws IOException
        Read the file and convert to a byte dataset. This implements readfully internally, so that it will read in the file without ever having to seek()
        Parameters:

        len - length of data to read
        Returns:
        the bytes

                     int len)

        Parameters:

        received - actual
        len - length of bytes to compare

        Returns:

      • rm

        public static boolean rm(FileSystem fileSystem,
         Path path,
         boolean recursive,
         boolean allowRootDelete)
                  throws IOException
        Delete a directory. There's a safety check for operations against the root directory -these are intercepted and rejected with an IOException unless the allowRootDelete flag is true
        Parameters:
        fileSystem - filesystem to work with. May be null
        path - path to delete
        recursive - flag to enable recursive delete
        allowRootDelete - can the root directory be deleted?
        Throws:
        IOException - on any problem.

        public static void rejectRootOperation(Path path,
                       boolean allowRootOperation)
                                throws IOException
        Block any operation on the root path. This is a safety check
        Parameters:
        path - path in the filesystem
        allowRootOperation - can the root directory be manipulated?
        Throws:
        IOException - if the operation was rejected

      • verifyReceivedData

        public static void verifyReceivedData(FileSystem fs,
                      Path path,
                      long expectedSize,
                      int bufferLen,
                      int modulus)
                               throws IOException
        Receives test data from the given input file and checks the size of the data as well as the pattern inside the received data.
        Parameters:
        fs - FileSystem
        path - Input file to be checked
        expectedSize - the expected size of the data to be read from the input file in bytes
        bufferLen - Pattern length
        modulus - Pattern modulus
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if an error occurs while reading the data

      • generateTestFile

        public static long generateTestFile(FileSystem fs,
                    Path path,
                    long size,
                    int bufferLen,
                    int modulus)
                             throws IOException
        Generates test data of the given size according to some specific pattern and writes it to the provided output file.
        Parameters:
        fs - FileSystem
        path - Test file to be generated
        size - The size of the test data to be generated in bytes
        bufferLen - Pattern length
        modulus - Pattern modulus
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if an error occurs while writing the data

      • createAndVerifyFile

        public static void createAndVerifyFile(FileSystem fs,
                       Path parent,
                       long fileSize)
                                throws IOException
        Creates and reads a file with the given size. The test file is generated according to a specific pattern so it can be easily verified even if it's a multi-GB one. During the read phase the incoming data stream is also checked against this pattern.
        Parameters:
        fs - FileSystem
        parent - Test file parent dir path
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if an I/O error occurs while writing or reading the test file
